department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
description: Canada is seeking offers from Offerors to provide one (1) tow behind runway sweeper and the accessories customarily furnished and installed on this type of unit. This runway sweeper is intended to replace the current runway sweeper at the St Anthony Airport and will be towed by a Snow Mauler. Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within 15 working days from receipt of notification that their bid was unsuccessful. Refer to the solicitation for further details.
full_summary:
### Runway Sweeper Special Action - Solicitation ID WS4257671683

#### Official Notice

**Request for Proposal**
The **Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)** on behalf of the **Department of Transport (TC)** seeks to locate a contractor to provide a **Tow Behind Runway Sweeper** for the St. Anthony Airport.

#### Solicitation Details

**Reference:** `WS4257671683-328907798`
**Publication Date:** December 27, 2023
**Closing Date:** January 30, 2024, at 14:00:00
**Amendment Date:** January 25, 2024
**Availability:** Concurrently, Open Bidding Procedure

#### Tender Information

The offered services include the supply and delivery of a duo-type mounted runway sweeper and accessories typically included with this item, tailored to meet Department of Transport needs at the St. Anthony Airport. Interested contractors are expected to submit comprehensive offers to PERSON Anonymous entity.

#### Negotiation Conditions

Contract requirements must include the right to supply a internationally usable runway sweeper that can operate for at least 12 years from the start date in any U.S., provided key element *22101600" is met.

Please note:
- Interested contractors should review government documentation prior to submitting a digitized offer letter outlining the terms of presentation.
- Those not executing STEP 3 shall not be invited to business breakfast beakinCasuel've assumes AWS

Acceptance will be selective with the lowest price determining the winning candidate.
